userStories.tip: Small, gradual changes in diet.  Acidity is linked largely to diet, and without diet changes, ANY over-the-counter drug simply masks a longer-term issue and does NOT solve it.
userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?

carousel_items: Can take a few days to start working.
Take Rabeprazole with or without food. It can work better for some people if it's taken 30 minutes before a meal.
Call your doctor if you have watery stools, stomach pain, or a fever because it could be a sign of a serious infection.
Rabeprazole can lower the amount of magnesium in your body. Initial and follow-up blood tests may be needed before starting Rabeprazole.

basics.benefits_moa: Rabeprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI). It lowers the amount of acid in your stomach, treats heartburn, and heals ulcers.
basics.bottom_line: Rabeprazole is an effective medicine to treat heartburn and ulcers, but can be expensive.
downsides: Taking Rabeprazole in high doses or for longer than 1 year can increase the risk for bone fractures, especially if you already have osteoporosis (weak bones).
Many drugs can interact with Rabeprazole, so talk to your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new medicines.
There's no generic version available, so it can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Taking Rabeprazole in high doses or for longer than 1 year can increase the risk for bone fractures, especially if you already have osteoporosis (weak bones).
Many drugs can interact with Rabeprazole, so talk to your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new medicines.
There's no generic version available, so it can be expensive.

upsides: Relieves heartburn symptoms and heals ulcers better than other stomach medicines, such as Pepcid, Tagamet, and Zantac.
Lasts longer than other similar stomach medicines. Most people take it once a day.
Your body won't develop a tolerance to Rabeprazole, so it'll work the same way as long as you need to keep taking it.
Once heartburn symptoms are treated, a low dose of Rabeprazole can be taken daily.

upsides_processed.orig: Relieves heartburn symptoms and heals ulcers better than other stomach medicines, such as Pepcid, Tagamet, and Zantac.
Lasts longer than other similar stomach medicines. Most people take it once a day.
Your body won't develop a tolerance to Rabeprazole, so it'll work the same way as long as you need to keep taking it.
Once heartburn symptoms are treated, a low dose of Rabeprazole can be taken daily.

userStories.identifier: Have a lack of stomach lining
userStories.tip: Don't mix it with cold and flu medicine, take before eating if taking early in morning. Not doing either of these causes vomiting.

drugs.name: Aciphex

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can take a few days to start working.
Take Rabeprazole with or without food. It can work better for some people if it's taken 30 minutes before a meal.
Call your doctor if you have watery stools, stomach pain, or a fever because it could be a sign of a serious infection.
Rabeprazole can lower the amount of magnesium in your body. Initial and follow-up blood tests may be needed before starting Rabeprazole.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Rabeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Rabeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis)
risks_warnings.description: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Rabeprazole.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Rabeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Rabeprazole.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Rabeprazole for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: Using medications like Rabeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Rabeprazole or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

description_processed.orig: Using medications like Rabeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Rabeprazole or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

risks_warnings.title: Broken bones
risks_warnings.description: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Rabeprazole (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Rabeprazole.  However, if you need to take Rabeprazole long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
risk_factors: Use of other medications that weaken bones

description_processed.orig: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Rabeprazole (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Rabeprazole.  However, if you need to take Rabeprazole long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.

risks_warnings.title: Low vitamin or mineral levels
risks_warnings.description: All proton pump inhibitor medications, including Rabeprazole, can cause low levels of blood magnesium or vitamin B12. This can happen with as little as 3 months of use but more commonly occurs after you've been using Rabeprazole for a year or more. Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.

description_processed.orig: All proton pump inhibitor medications, including Rabeprazole, can cause low levels of blood magnesium or vitamin B12. This can happen with as little as 3 months of use but more commonly occurs after you've been using Rabeprazole for a year or more. Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.

carousel_items: Take 1 hour before a meal.
Don't chew or crush capsules; swallow them whole.
If you have trouble swallowing you can carefully open the capsules and sprinkle the inside pellets onto applesauce. Swallow the applesauce without chewing or crushing the pellets.

When using Omeprazole long-term, take a calcium citrate with vitamin D supplement daily to prevent bone loss. Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
Get a blood test for your magnesium level once a year; you may need a magnesium supplement while using Omeprazole.
Avoid drug interactions by telling your doctor all of the other medications or herbal supplements you take before starting Omeprazole.

clock.tip: Take on an empty stomach before breakfast.

basics.benefits_moa: Omeprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI). It lowers the amount of acid in your stomach, treats heartburn, and heals ulcers.
basics.bottom_line: Omeprazole gives you long-lasting heartburn relief. Choose the cheapest proton pump inhibitor because they all work equally well for heartburn.
downsides: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Like with other proton pump inhibitors, long-term use can cause weak or broken bones.
Can cause low levels of magnesium in the blood. You might need to take a magnesium supplement if you use Omeprazole long-term.
Although the generic is affordable, other medications might still be cheaper than Omeprazole.
Can interact with other drugs so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Omeprazole.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Like with other proton pump inhibitors, long-term use can cause weak or broken bones.
Can cause low levels of magnesium in the blood. You might need to take a magnesium supplement if you use Omeprazole long-term.
Although the generic is affordable, other medications might still be cheaper than Omeprazole.
Can interact with other drugs so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Omeprazole.

upsides: Most people can take Omeprazole without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Omeprazole lasts longer than other types of antacids (like Zantac, Pepcid, or Tums), and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
In studies it was better than a placebo (sugar pill) and as good as other proton pump inhibitors at treating heartburn.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.

In studies it was better than a placebo (sugar pill) and as good as other proton pump inhibitors at treating heartburn.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.

userStories.identifier: Golf twice a wk, not good but ok for 87.
userStories.tip: Took Nexium for seven years, then found Omerprazole. Worked so well for two years that I cut the caplets in half two years ago. All's well so far. Have forgotten a few times but remember real quick, within two hours, discomfort.
Take in the morning when you get up.

The generics don't work as well as name-brand Prilosec, but it could just be placebo effect. I could get it much cheaper from the pharmacy for awhile (until my prescription plan stopped covering it) so ask your doctor if that's an option.

userStories.identifier: Parent, average weight and activity leve
userStories.tip: Take it at the same time every day.

I was having horrible acid reflux and was diagnosed with Barrett's rings in my esophagus 9 years ago. Since I started taking this simple drug, the acid reflux is completely gone and the ring growth has been arrested.

Skipping a dose or two does not seem to cause problems.   Occasional break-through heartburn easily fixed with Tums.  Even with a large copay it is cheaper if you get a prescription and have it filled at the pharmacy.
Take 40 mg case I have Barrett and risk of oesaphageal cancer good product better ones out there but does the job

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: This pill gave me an uncertain feeling in my stomach, and my heart burn didn't really go although it did reduce. Stopped taking them in favour of ranitidine and gaviscon.

I take 10mg every morning at least an hour before I eat something. As long as I follow this rule every day, I never have heartburn. If I don't, I will get heartburn regularly over even the most mildest foods.
Take in the morning before eating ... huge help.
Taking it every day 30mins before breakfast results in no heartburn at all. But i´m concerned about long term side effects like problems in B12 inhibit, calcium, colesterol

When using Pantoprazole long-term, take a calcium citrate with vitamin D supplement daily to prevent bone loss. Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
Get a blood test for your magnesium level once a year; you may need a magnesium supplement while using Pantoprazole.

userStories.tip: Helped for a couple months, then I started getting acid reflux WAY worse than ever before. I stopped taking it and thankfully the acid reflux got better again. Would not recommend for extended amounts of time.
Pretty happy overall, works for me but if I stop taking it or any of the pump inhibitors Ive tried, symptoms return.
I have had huge relief from it. Will take for 6 to9 months until controlled
since it has to be taken 30 minutes before breakfast, it does interfere with morning routine.
symptoms return as soon as you stop

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I felt like I had the flu, with nausea and diarrhea with muscle aches.  Symptoms got worse the longer I took the medicine.  I also became extremely lactose intolerant.  I was sensitive to lactose before but got to a point where I could not tolerate any dairy while taking this medicine.  Within a few days of stopping this medicine, my symptoms went away.

userStories.identifier: Been taking Protonix for over a decade.
userStories.tip: My doctor is concerned that long-term use of protonix by women has been connected to a higher risk of bone density loss and I am personally concerned about the risk of nutritional deficiencies.
had trouble getting 2xday covered by insurance, but sending in results of a gastroscopy did the trick

risks_warnings.title: Stomach cancer
risks_warnings.description: In animal studies, long-term use of Pantoprazole caused rare types of stomach tumors. Since acid-reflux disease (commonly known as heartburn) can last for a long time some people may find that they need to take Pantoprazole for a long time as well.  It is unknown if the risk for stomach tumors is the same for people as it is for other animals.

description_processed.orig: In animal studies, long-term use of Pantoprazole caused rare types of stomach tumors. Since acid-reflux disease (commonly known as heartburn) can last for a long time some people may find that they need to take Pantoprazole for a long time as well.  It is unknown if the risk for stomach tumors is the same for people as it is for other animals.

carousel_items: Short-term treatment of ulcers and acid reflux.

basics.benefits_moa: Famotidine is a type of antacid called an H2 blocker. It blocks the chemical histamine, which lowers acid production in your stomach. This treats heartburn and helps ulcers heal.
basics.bottom_line: Famotidine works well for heartburn but may not last as long or start working as quickly as other antacids.
downsides: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Famotidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Famotidine (H2 blockers).
Can cause more serious side effects for people with kidney disease. Ask your doctor to give you a lower dose or choose a different option.

downsides_processed.orig: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Famotidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Famotidine (H2 blockers).
Can cause more serious side effects for people with kidney disease. Ask your doctor to give you a lower dose or choose a different option.

upsides: Most people can take Famotidine without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Famotidine lasts longer than many other antacids like Maalox and Tums, and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.
Few drug interactions.

Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.
Few drug interactions.

drugs.name: Pepcid

carousel_items_processed.orig: Short-term treatment of ulcers and acid reflux.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Famotidine for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Famotidine for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Because Famotidine is processed by the kidney it can cause some worrisome side effects for people with kidney problems. These include confusion, delirium, and a dangerous irregular heartbeat known as QT prolongation.   If you have kidney problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.

description_processed.orig: Because Famotidine is processed by the kidney it can cause some worrisome side effects for people with kidney problems. These include confusion, delirium, and a dangerous irregular heartbeat known as QT prolongation.   If you have kidney problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Famotidine can cause an allergic reaction.  The reaction might cause swelling of the throat, face, lips or tongue, difficulty breathing, or rash. If this happens to you stop taking Famotidine and get medical help right away. Do not take Famotidine if you have ever had an allergic reaction to similar medications like zantac or tagamet.

description_processed.orig: Famotidine can cause an allergic reaction.  The reaction might cause swelling of the throat, face, lips or tongue, difficulty breathing, or rash. If this happens to you stop taking Famotidine and get medical help right away. Do not take Famotidine if you have ever had an allergic reaction to similar medications like zantac or tagamet.

carousel_items: Works best if you take it with a full glass of water.
Starts working in one hour.
If heartburn doesn't improve or lasts more than 2 weeks, talk to your doctor.
People with kidney disease may need to take a lower dose.

basics.benefits_moa: Zantac is an H2 blocker. It blocks the chemical histamine, which lowers acid production in your stomach. This treats heartburn and helps ulcers heal.
basics.bottom_line: Zantac works well for heartburn but may not last as long or start working as quickly as other antacids.
downsides: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Ranitidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Ranitidine (H2 blockers).

downsides_processed.orig: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Ranitidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Ranitidine (H2 blockers).

upsides: Most people can take Ranitidine without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Ranitidine lasts longer than many other antacids like Maalox and Tums, and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.
Few drug interactions.

upsides_processed.orig: Most people can take Ranitidine without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Ranitidine lasts longer than many other antacids like Maalox and Tums, and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.
Few drug interactions.

userStories.tip: some times i have seen that some physicians used to prescribe renitidine as a co-medicine since it is not of use, & a wast majority of people uses this drug as a medication for Indigestion, Vomiting, etc

I take 300mg daily divided into 2 doses. I have a hiatus hernia and have been taking this medication for most of the last 30 years. I am allergic to any others and would not be without this medication.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Works best if you take it with a full glass of water.
Starts working in one hour.
If heartburn doesn't improve or lasts more than 2 weeks, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Zantac for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Zantac for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Zantac is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.

description_processed.orig: Zantac is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Attacks of acute porphyria
risks_warnings.description: Zantac can cause attacks of blood disease called acute porphyria.  Don't use Zantac if you have acute porphyria.

description_processed.orig: Zantac can cause attacks of blood disease called acute porphyria.  Don't use Zantac if you have acute porphyria.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: People with sensitivity to phenylketones and phenylalanine should NOT take Zantac "EFFERdose" tablets. This dosage form contains phenylalanine as an ingredient. The other dosage forms of Zantac do not contain phenylalanine.

description_processed.orig: People with sensitivity to phenylketones and phenylalanine should NOT take Zantac "EFFERdose" tablets. This dosage form contains phenylalanine as an ingredient. The other dosage forms of Zantac do not contain phenylalanine.

basics.bottom_line: Famotidine works well for heartburn but may not last as long or start working as quickly as other antacids.

Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Famotidine (H2 blockers).
Can cause more serious side effects for people with kidney disease. Ask your doctor to give you a lower dose or choose a different option.

surveys.tip: Small, gradual changes in diet.  Acidity is linked largely to diet, and without diet changes, ANY over-the-counter drug simply masks a longer-term issue and does NOT solve it.
surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
